body_html: If you had a build with debug on, then we might be able to see what the intermediate stack frames are. ReductionInitKernel appears to have been passed nullptr + offset (maybe 300 or so), so it's pulled from a struct which has about 300 bytes worth of stuff before the output, and that struct instance pointer is nullptr, presumably.
body_text: If you had a build with debug on, then we might be able to see what the intermediate stack frames are. ReductionInitKernel appears to have been passed nullptr + offset (maybe 300 or so), so it's pulled from a struct which has about 300 bytes worth of stuff before the output, and that struct instance pointer is nullptr, presumably.
body: If you had a build with debug on, then we might be able to see what the intermediate stack frames are. `ReductionInitKernel` appears to have been passed `nullptr` + offset (maybe 300 or so), so it's pulled from a struct which has about 300 bytes worth of stuff before the output, and that struct instance pointer is nullptr, presumably.
